title.narrative: PFM and accountability to support service delivery PforR

description.narrative: The project development objective (PDO) is to improve public financial management and procurement systems for better management and accountability in service delivery for health and education sectors.

title.narrative: Reduction in cash held outside the Recipient’s Treasury Single Account

baseline.value: (FY 2016-17) Federal Government Deposits of PKRs 0.916 trillion parked in commercial bank accounts of which PKRs 0 billion wasbrought into the TSA.

target.value: 15% of baseline or additional PKRs 50 billion brought under the TSA(US $ 1 million for PKRs 10 billion brought under the TSA)

actual.value: PKRs 5 billion of funds brought in the TSA

title.narrative: Percentage of vendor contracts processed through the Recipient’s e-procurement system

target.value: 50 to 90 percent of targeted packages (whose contract amount is more than PKR 5 million for goods and services and more than PKR 50million for works) to be processed through e-procurement for targeted primary health and primary education sectors.

actual.value: Development of e-Procurement system is in progress

title.narrative: Percentage of fiscal performance and service delivery indicators met by the provinces

target.value: Innovation award provided from the Ministry of Finance of the Recipient to the provincial governments for at least 35 percent up to70 percent of fiscal performance and service delivery indicators met.

title.narrative: Financial transactions of health and education function recorded in FABS audited through Computer Ai
E-procurement guidelines issued and Supplier Relations Management Module operational in health and education
Citizen Participatory Audit reports that cover indicators in the ISDR published.
Number of departments with vendor claims for health and education departments paid at accounting offices. electronically
Databases or records are maintained for contracts, including data on what has been procured, value o
End user training in e-Procurement system
Innovative applications used to report and account for funds utilized.
Bank reconciliation of all active government bank accounts in the TSA takes place at least monthly at
Percentage of audit recommendations processed through the Audit Management Information System.

baseline.value: Audit Management Information System does not exist

target.value: 80 percent of PAC recommendations for health, education and at least four more sectors effectively followed-up and reportspublished on an official website or by any other means easily accessible to the public

title.narrative: Improve the timeliness of comprehensive financial and nonfinancial reporting by linkage or interface

baseline.value: Dashboard for fiscal information does not exist

target.value: Comprehensive reports published on Ministry of Finance Dashboard and updated at least on monthly basis

title.narrative: Notification of revised updated delegation of power, General Financial Rules, Accounting Policies and Procedures Manual and Chart of Accounts.

baseline.value: Legal Framework for Public Financial Management in terms of Law and Subsidiary Rules does not exist

target.value: Regulatory Framework updated (PFM law, Functions and Powers of PAO, Receipt and Payment Rules, General Financial Rules, APPM andChart of Accounts)

actual.value: Regulations for delegation of powers to PAOs notified

title.narrative: Citizen Portal set up to facilitate Citizen Participatory Audits, including fraud hotline for feedback
Reports of PAC hearings on audit report on annual financial statements are published on the website
Approved Cash Management Policy with accounting framework for daily consolidation of all government

baseline.value: Regulatory framework for Cash Management does not exist

target.value: Legal Framework including law and subsidiary rules for cash management in place

title.narrative: Internal Audit arrangements modernized in health and education departments.

baseline.value: Regulatory framework for internal audit function does not exist

target.value: Internal Audit Reports for Health and Education issued

title.narrative: Percent of budget derived from procurement plans in selected federal ministries of health and education
Reduction of variance in functional expenditure composition for health and education

baseline.value: Variance in health and education for fiscal year 2016-17(Federal) - 26% (Punjab) - 21 % (Khyber Pakhunkhwa) -29% (Sindh) - 11%for fiscal year 2016-17(Baluchistan) - 10%

target.value: Less than 10 percent variance in functional expenditure composition for health and education as measured by variation betweenoriginal approved budget and actual expenditures.

title.narrative: Incentive system by the FCC to improve fiscal performance and service delivery in selected areas
